Submodules

json_protocol.json_client module

class json_protocol.json_client.ChatClient(host, port)[source]

Bases: object

A GUI-based chat client for sending and receiving messages.

clear_messages()[source]

Clears all messages displayed in the chat window.

create_account()[source]

Sends a request to the server to create a new account.

delete_account()[source]

Sends a request to the server to delete the user’s account.

delete_message(msg_id)[source]

Deletes a specific message.

Parameters:

msg_id (int) – ID of the message to delete.

delete_selected_messages()[source]

Deletes all selected messages in the chat window.

handle_message(message)[source]

Handles incoming messages from the server.

Parameters:

message (dict) – The received message.

login()[source]

Sends a login request to the server.

logout()[source]

Logs out the current user from the server.

on_closing()[source]

Handles cleanup when the chat window is closed.

on_connection_lost()[source]

Handles server disconnection and shuts down the client.

on_user_select(event)[source]

Handles user selection from the accounts list.

Parameters:

event (tk.Event) – The triggered event.

receive_messages()[source]

Continuously receives and processes messages from the server.

refresh_messages()[source]

Fetches and displays the message history.

refresh_unread_messages()[source]

Fetches and displays only unread messages.

run()[source]

Runs the chat client application.

search_accounts()[source]

Sends a request to the server to search for users.

send_command(command)[source]

Sends a JSON command to the server.

Parameters:

command (dict) – The command dictionary to send.

send_message()[source]

Sends a message to the selected recipient.

setup_accounts_frame()[source]

Configures the user search and account list UI.

setup_auth_frame()[source]

Configures the login and registration UI components.

setup_chat_frame()[source]

Configures the chat window layout and message display.

setup_gui()[source]

Sets up the graphical user interface for the chat client.

json_protocol.json_client.main()[source]

Parses command-line arguments and starts the chat client.

json_protocol.json_server module

class json_protocol.json_server.ChatServer(host=None, port=None)[source]

Bases: object

A multi-threaded chat server that handles client connections, user authentication, and message exchange using JSON protocol.

host

Server host address.

Type:

str

port

Server port number.

Type:

int

users

Stores user credentials and settings.

Type:

dict

messages

Stores messages per user.

Type:

defaultdict

active_users

Tracks active user connections.

Type:

dict

message_id_counter

Counter for message IDs.

Type:

int

lock

Lock for thread-safe operations.

Type:

threading.Lock

server

Server socket.

Type:

socket.socket

running

Indicates whether the server is running.

Type:

bool

broadcast_user_list()[source]

Broadcasts the updated user list to all active clients.

Returns:

List of users with online/offline status.

Return type:

list

find_free_port(start_port)[source]

Finds an available port starting from a given port.

Parameters:

start_port (int) – Starting port number.

Returns:

First available port number.

Return type:

int

Raises:

RuntimeError – If no free ports are available.

get_messages(username)[source]

Retrieves read messages for a user.

Parameters:

username (str) – Username to retrieve messages for.

Returns:

List of sorted read messages.

list

username (str) – Username to check messages for.

Retrieves unread messages for a user.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Username to retrieve messages for.

  • count (int) – Number of messages to retrieve.

Returns:

List of sorted unread messages.

Return type:

list

handle_client(client_socket, address)[source]

Handles communication with a connected client.

Parameters:

  • client_socket (socket.socket) – Client socket object.

  • address (tuple) – Client’s IP address and port.

hash_password(password)[source]

Hashes a password using SHA-256.

Parameters:

password (str) – Password to be hashed.

Returns:

Hashed password.

Return type:

str

start()[source]

Starts the chat server.

This method initializes the server, finds an available port, binds the server to the host and port, and starts listening for incoming client connections. It runs in a loop to accept and handle clients until stopped.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If no free ports are available for the server.

stop()[source]

Stops the chat server.

This method gracefully shuts down the server by closing the socket and stopping the running server loop.

validate_password(password)[source]

Validates password strength.

Parameters:

password (str) – Password to be validated.

Returns:

True if password meets requirements, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
